Dawn comes softer than a sleeping breath
Your dream runs through the forest now
You wake up and stir to find the light
If you have lost it, I will find it for you
It is hidden in our future
Now if we joined hands
we could go far away without letting go
In the memory of a far off day
the story of the blue country bloomed
Shining eyes
Your singing voice
Let us share it
No...
I do not want to be alone anymore!
Horo...
That is right, I remember now.
There is someone who truly loves me.
What are you to me?
No...
What am I to you?
Wolf and End of Shallowness
In the end...
he was just a small-minded trader.
Indeed.
If he cannot do anything to comfort a lady as beautiful as you,
he is nothing but a failure as a man.
You will protect me whatever happens, unlike him, right?
Of course.
Even if all my fortunes were taken away, I would still have my love for you.
Craft Lawrence is nothing but a coward.
Amarty...
Do not be stupid!
Geez, I warned you.
You were so full of confidence before, but look at you now.
This was unforeseen.
Completely outside my expectations.
You mean you let your guard down.
Be honest.
You are right.
So, what did you want to ask?
If you are after a loan, I cannot help you.
I want to know which way the wind is blowing.
Like setting sail and going out to sea,
for an outsider like myself, the day to day market trends are unpredictable.
Give it up.
You cannot stop its value from rising any more than you can stop a raging horse.
The auction placards only increase in number the more they are sold.
There are no signs that prices will be falling anytime soon.
Unless you are an omnipotent god, there is no way you can change that.
Then I will just have to play god.
I doubt Amarty will allow himself to be caught by a predictable price drop.
Are you planning to crash the market?!
That is my only choice, right?
At any rate,
I have got to turn all that pyrite he bought into plain rocks by sunset tomorrow.
A ploy that Amarty would not be able to read...
A ploy that will crash the market...
Could such a trick exist?
Take a look at these!
You are putting a lot on this!
Are you leaving the wheat business for mining?
Rumor has it its value will double by tomorrow.
Double?
Are you sure?
Almost certain.
If you close up shop for the festival, you will miss a chance to set sail!
This is no time to be seriously buying wheat, eh?
Mr. Lawrence!
A letter?
I wrote it just a moment ago at the request of your companion.
200 silver in cash,
300 silver worth of pyrite, and 200 silver in saleable property...
These are Amarty's assets!
Horo...
This is...
Amarty's handwriting?
That Horo.
Did she make him sign another crazy contract?
Take out all the cash I stored here!
All of it!
What is up with him?
It is that guy, remember?
Hey!
Watch where you are going!
Excuse me.
O-Okay...
Good evening.
You do not have to be so wary.
I just came to talk business.
That is all the more reason to put up my guard.
Might you have a moment?
Of course.
You said business talk, right?
Frequently as of late, television programs have been
illegally misappropriated for use on the internet.
Distribution
of this program on the internet is crazy awesome
and we encourage you to keep at it.
Remember to seed!
Yes.
What exactly are you planning?
I will get right to it.
I would like to sell you some pyrite.
I would like to sell you some pyrite.
500 Trenni silver worth, at its current market value.
You are joking.
It is no joke.
Surely you are aware that I am profiting off pyrite resale.
What do you mean to accomplish by selling it to me?
Could the rumors that you would give up Horo as long as you get the money be true?
By the name of St. Lambardos who watches over the Rowen Trading Guild from heaven,
I swear that I shall profess my sincere love to her!
He is almost like a heroic knight.
But if that is the case, the only thing we can do is observe the opponent's actions directly.
How sneaky.
You really are a knight.
Ah, excuse me.
Of course, I still care about her.
Horo is a very important person to me.
Then why?
I do not intend to hand the pyrite over in a simple sale.
I want to sell on credit.
Basically,
I want to sell you 500 Trenni silver worth of pyrite tomorrow evening at its current market price.
In that case, why not discuss this tomorrow?
No.
I want to receive the payment now.
I will accept 500 silver from you now.
And then tomorrow evening, I will give you 500 silver worth of pyrite at its value right now.
So even if the value of pyrite rises tomorrow,
I will still receive 500 silver worth of pyrite at its current lower value.
As expected,
you catch on quick.
On the other hand, if the value drops tomorrow, I will also still receive the same amount.
Correct.
How is this any different from a standard transaction?
If you sell something and its value increases, you would regret it,
and if its value decreases, you would be at ease.
If you think of it that way, it is not really...
No, that is wrong.
Do you understand now?
This way, even if you did not have the money on hand, you could still acquire the goods.
And after that, no matter how much its value changed, you would just have to pay back the original price.
So if its value rises, you would make a profit.
Yes, that is buying on credit.
So when I actually give you the pyrite, if its value has fallen then I will have profited by that much.
There are many ways to conduct business, are not there.
Do you get the idea now?
I understand the meaning behind the deal you are proposing now.
If I buy 500 silver worth of pyrite from you,
my profits will go up if its value increases,
but in the case that it goes down, it is possible I will make an immeasurable loss.
In other words, this is
Right.
I am challenging you to a duel, Amarty.
Even assuming the value of pyrite falls tomorrow evening,
I would just have to sell some off beforehand, while the price is still high.
In other words, I can step away from the duel whenever I want.
Since I can reach my goal with just a slight increase in value, this deal would be too unfair for you, would not it?
I would not want to make a contract for the sake of my own profit, at your loss.
Not at all.
Such a disadvantage is just about right.
There is the possibility that Horo rips up the contract that she signed with you.
Even if you pay back the 1000 silver debt, you are relying dangerously on Horo accepting your proposal.
My disadvantage is nothing compared to that risk.
I have heard the two of you had quite a fight.
In our travels, Horo has cried in my arms three times.
When she is like that, she is very cute,
but also quite stubborn.
She tends to say things she does not really mean.
In other words...
I accept!
Pardon me,
but I had thought that taking everything from you would have been too harsh, which is why I initially declined.
But if you put it like that, I will accept.
In fact I will strip you of all your poessessions!
Shall we seal the contract then?
As you wish.
Cheers!
This is good beer.
Have you had any good ideas?
Do not wheat sales pick up at the end of the festival?
They do.
When that time comes, I would like you to spread a rumor.
I am not going to do anything risky.
It may be risky if you were to say it yourself,
but there would be no problem if it was the boy, right?
I guess it is about time for wheat prices to go up.
You plan to lower the price of these stones with a rumor?
Yes.
Most people buying pyrite are here to sell their wares, then pick up something else to take back.
The most common load would be wheat.
When the time comes to buy, if they hear that the price of wheat is going up,
they will sell off their pocket-money pyrite and rush off to buy what they originally came for.
When that happens, the value of pyrite will inevitably fall.
And when it reaches a critical point, it will plummet down to nothing.
I did not think you were so simple-minded.
What if I said I plan to sell a substantial amount of pyrite at the same time?
How much?
One thousand Trenni silver worth.
A thousand?!
No wa
Do you have any idea how much you will lose by doing that?
I do not care how much its value drops.
Have you completely lost it?
No.
If I can get 500 silver worth of pyrite by the end of it all,
however much the price rises or falls, I will not lose out.
Damn!
You are selling on credit?
Exactly.
So is that all you wanted me to do?
No, there is one more thing.
I would like you to buy up Pyrite.
Did not you make the contract after finding a buyer?
Unfortunately I did not have the time.
You are hopeless...
The best way to buy it up quietly, without affecting the market,
would be to influence the town merchants to each buy a little, right?
I do not mind if you have to pay a little more than market value.
If they will buy a relatively large amount, I will pay in Rumione gold coins.
I will also pay you for your services.
Respectably, too.
No can do.
Good, then...
Huh?
I said I would pay you!
And not any small amount, either.
There is no way you will lose out!
I will not lose out?
I am right, are not I?
I am not asking you to make an investment, and of course I will pay in cash.
What could you possibly have to lose?
You would be able to pay ten Rumione at best, right?
That is more than enough for you to buy on proxy.
It is not like I am asking you to travel a rocky mountain yourself and bring back a ridiculous amount or anything!
If you are asking me to go around the market buying up pyrite, then it is the same thing.
What about that is the same!
There are no risks!
I am just asking you to buy pyrite through your connections.
You are looking at the risks from the perspective of a traveling merchant.
I am a town merchant whose battlefield is this marketplace.
Town traders who look to profit from easy money have accepted that their primary business will suffer.
I am the owner of this store,
but it is not just my name that is at stake.
The honor of myself, my wife,
and everyone related to us
even my regular customers.
All of that is on the line.
There is no virtue in a town merchant who shows no hesitation in jumping at every opportunity to make easy money.
Well, making a little pocket money on the side is not a bad thing.
but buying up 500 silver worth of pyrite is a totally different story.
What would the townsfolk think of me?
In their eyes, I would be nothing but a worthless merchant who threw his store to the curb on a gamble.
Can you offer a reward that matches that risk?
Even for a small shop like mine, the value of the name on the signboard is surprisingly high.
If that were tarnished, ten or twenty gold coins would not be enough to buy it back.
That is just the way it is.
I am sorry.
No, I am sorry for asking such a thing.
With that companion of yours, I guess it is understandable.
But even if you were to act a little less frantically, she would not be swayed that easily, right?
Even after seeing her with you only once, that is the impression I get.
Have some confidence in yourself.
A signed marriage certificate was handed to me.
If her guardian ratifies it, the marriage will be complete.
If nothing had happened, of course I would be confident.
In this world, darkness lies an inch ahead, eh?
But you are still running the race because you have hope, right?
Right.
You are quite a daredevil.
Is there anyone else you can go to?
I will try asking Bartose for the time being.
I see.
If you get him to talk to that woman...
That woman?
You know, the chronicler.
Remember her?
That woman has control over this district.
You could say she is the means by which one communicates with the alchemists.
Alchemists are easy targets for various reasons, but so many are able to gather here,
mostly due to the presence of that woman.
So?
Alchemists have pyrite, right?
If you want to make trades without disrupting the market, you will have to deal with them.
In other words...
In other words, their pyrite is untouched!
That is about all I can do for you.
I know I refused to help, but I am rooting for you.
I have learned something important.
That in itself is profit.
Well...
Although I cannot do anything publicly,
leaking out the amount of money someone is carrying would not be impossible.
Mark...
Come back later.
I will look into potential buyers.
I am sure the wind will blow your way.
Do your best.
Right...
Right!
Geez...
You are so predictable it is cute.
If she saw that face of yours, even that princess might do something bold.
What do you mean?
